document_title: Primary infertility: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
1. In women
The doctor will do a clinical examination and conduct tests to find problems during ovulation. Tests to diagnose primary infertility in women include:
Uterine ovary scan.; Check the reserve capacity of the ovaries.; Hormone testing.; Check for ovulation.; Pelvic ultrasound.
2. In men
Men will be clinically examined by a doctor and conduct tests to find problems in ejaculation and sperm production. Tests to diagnose primary infertility in men include:
Semen analysis.; Hormone testing.; Scrotal ultrasound.; Testing for genetic problems; Testicular biopsy (in case other exploratory measures fail to find sperm)
